articles.author: Daniel Fastenberg, Kevin Fogarty, Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: It is the birthplace of U.S. independence, the "City of Brotherly Love," and the hometown of beloved fictional boxer "Rocky" Balboa.
articles.title: Philadelphia gears up for Harris-Trump debate with protests expected

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German Interior Minister Nancy Faeser will on Monday announce temporary border controls at all of Germany's land borders, a government source told Reuters.
articles.title: Germany to put temporary controls on all land borders, source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. prosecutors unveiled criminal charges on Monday against two alleged leaders of a white supremacist gang, accusing them of soliciting attacks on Black, Jewish, LGBTQ people and immigrants in hopes of inciting a race war.
articles.title: US charges alleged white supremacist gangsters with trying to incite race war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's foreign ministry said on Monday it had summoned a senior Iranian diplomat to warn of "devastating and irreparable consequences" for bilateral relations if reports that Tehran had supplied Russia with ballistic missiles were correct.
articles.title: Ukraine summons Iranian diplomat as Tehran denies missile transfer to Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 14 people were killed late on Sunday in multiple Israeli strikes targeting the vicinity of Masyaf, a city in Syria's Hama province, Syria's state news agency reported on Monday.
articles.title: Israeli strikes on Syria kill at least 14 people, Syrian state media say

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The new school year in the Palestinian territories officially began on Monday, with all schools in Gaza shut after 11 months of war and no sign of a ceasefire.
articles.title: Fear of 'lost generation' as Gaza school year begins with all classes shut

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said the country is now implementing a nuclear force construction policy to increase the number of nuclear weapons "exponentially," state media KCNA said on Tuesday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un says country to increase number of nuclear weapons, KCNA says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Typhoon Yagi and the landslides and floods it triggered have killed at least 24 people and injured another 299 in northern Vietnam on the weekend, the government said, as authorities on Monday warned of more flooding.
articles.title: Vietnam's death toll from Typhoon Yagi rises to 24, govt says

articles.author: Bill Trott, Lisa Richwine
articles.description: American actor James Earl Jones, an imposing stage and screen presence who overcame a childhood stutter to develop a stentorian voice recognized the world over as intergalactic villain Darth Vader, died on Monday at the age of 93.
articles.title: James Earl Jones, renowned actor and voice of Darth Vader, dies at 93

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kate, Britain's Princess of Wales, said on Monday she had finished her course of preventative chemotherapy for cancer and would be carrying out a handful of public engagements later this year, but said her path to full recovery would be long.
articles.title: Kate, Britain's Princess of Wales, says she has finished chemotherapy course
